column2: Our company is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented individual to fill the role of Time and Resource Coordinator. The ideal candidate must possess excellent communication and mail-writing skills, as well as a strong ability to manage timesheet data, purchase orders, and invoices in a timely and confidential manner.       Key Responsibilities:       1. Communication Skills:- Demonstrate strong communication and mail-writing skills to interact effectively with clients, team members, and suppliers.     2. Timesheet Management: - Collect timesheets from all resources deployed across clients between the 20th and 25th of each month.         Share collected timesheet data with the account team by the 25th of the month, subject to senior verification.     3. Purchase Order Management: - Request new or revised purchase orders (PO) from clients as needed.   Maintain all PO data and, based on quantity or end date, request new POs from clients.   Release new or revised POs to subsidiaries, suppliers, and vendors.     4. Invoice Validation and Payment Processing:   Validate invoices against approved timesheets and PO/SO number line items.   Maintain invoice data in a secure drive.   Release payment data to the account team for all subsidiaries, suppliers, and vendors.     5. Follow-ups and Coordination:   Follow up on POs from clients and approved timesheets from resources.   Ensure timely coordination with clients, team members, and suppliers.     6. Confidentiality and Data Security:   Handle all data with the utmost confidentiality.   Any breach of confidentiality will result in immediate termination.     7. Team Collaboration:   Assist other team members during free time to ensure efficient workflow.     Qualifications:     - Strong communication and mail writing skills.     - Exceptional organizational and time management skills.     - Attention to detail and accuracy in data handling.     - Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.     - Proven experience in timesheet and purchase order management.     - Familiarity with invoice validation processes.

column2: We are seeking an experienced Sourcing and Procurement professional to join our expanding Global Sourcing and Procurement (GSP) team. Do you excel in leading strategic sourcing projects, performing data analysis, and negotiating various agreements across multiple spend categories? Are you looking for a great opportunity to raise the bar and expand your skill set in different Sourcing and Procurement areas? Are you passionate about developing, driving, and executing strategic sourcing strategies?             ?       Years of Experience       5 years of experience in procurement with a strong focus on technology procurement             ?       Qualifications         bachelors degree preferred in Business, Information Systems (or MIS), Economics, Finance, Legal, Supply Chain Management. Four additional years of relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.     Certified Professional in Supply Management (CPSM), Certified Purchase Manager (C.P.M.) or equivalent certification (preferred)             Responsibilities         Support Senior Sourcing and Procurement managers in executing strategic sourcing plans across multiple stakeholder groups with a strong emphasis on IT business unit, services including professional and implementation services, infrastructure hardware, and telecom (wireless and wireline), etc     Identify sourcing opportunities to reduce costs, increase services and manage company risk.     Conduct research and benchmarking; collaborate across different teams to provide subject matter expertise related to the specific contractual spend or based on the assigned category spend.     Support supplier selection process by preparing and running RFx.     Draft and negotiate assigned contracts up to final authorization under the direction provided by Senior Sourcing and Procurement managers.     Ensure compliance with procurement policies, standards, and guidelines.     Manage the assigned contracts and suppliers in close partnership with the stakeholders.     Continuously drive to improve program quality, budget adherence, and successful outcomes.     Support Senior Sourcing and Procurement managers in the end-to-end category strategy mapping and defining an improvement plan for the near, mid, and long term to meet and exceed savings goals.     Act as subject matter expert in relation to the assigned contracts, drive process improvement, P2P process, and dispute resolution for suppliers under management.             Candidate Requirements         Excellent analytical, presentation, communication, interpersonal and influencing skills.     Action-oriented and solution-minded team player with a high degree of self-management.     Focus on process orientation and have excellent attention to detail.     Experience with support applications like Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM), Spend Analytics and Procure-to-Pay (P2P) and Source-to-Pay (S2P)     Logical reasoning, analytical and problem-solving skills/methodology     Able to work independently and as a member of a team.     Able to balance and prioritize multiple high-priority projects.     Proficiency with Microsoft applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint required.             Core Values           Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication and collaboration skills with all levels of management         Strong organizational skills including the ability to adapt to shifting priorities and meet frequent deadlines,         Demonstrated a proactive approach to problem-solving with strong judgment and decision-making capability.         Highly resourceful and collaborative team player, with the ability to also be independently effective and exude initiative and a sense of urgency.         Exemplifies our customer-focused, action-oriented, results-driven culture.         Forward-looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities, has a desire for continuous learning, and proposes solutions.         Ability to act with discretion and maintain complete confidentiality.         Dedicated to the firm s values of non-negotiable integrity, valuing our people, exceeding client expectations, and embracing intellectual curiosity and rigour.

column2: Cleared CA/ CA inter Key Responsibilities: Manage end-to-end procurement processes, including requisitioning, sourcing, purchase order creation, and invoice processing, ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures. Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, such as finance, supply chain, and department heads, to understand procurement requirements and facilitate timely procurement of goods and services. Conduct vendor identification, evaluation, and selection processes to ensure alignment with organizational objectives, quality standards, and cost-effectiveness. Negotiate terms and conditions with suppliers to optimize pricing, delivery schedules, and contractual agreements, while mitigating risks. Monitor supplier performance, track key performance indicators (KPIs), and implement corrective actions as necessary to maintain service levels and address any issues or concerns. Utilize procurement software systems to streamline processes, generate reports, and analyze data for insights into procurement performance and opportunities for improvement. Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and regulatory requirements related to procurement, and make recommendations for process enhancements or policy updates as needed. Provide guidance and support to team members on procurement-related matters, including training, troubleshooting, and process adherence. Assist in the development and implementation of procurement strategies to optimize efficiency, reduce costs, and drive continuous improvement in the procure-to-pay process. Support internal and external audits by providing documentation, conducting audits of procurement records, and addressing any findings or recommendations.

column2: Skill required:  Procurement Operations - Procurement Support Designation:  Procurement Operations Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  What would you do? Go beyond processing purchase orders at lower costs to help clients reap savings and value from the billions they spend on the goods and services that run their day-to-day business operations. You will be working as a part of Procurement management team which uses a systematic approach for buying all the goods and services needed for a company to stay sustainable. They are involved in the identification of need, finding and qualifying the suppliers, requesting proposals, negotiating with suppliers, contracting, delivery and analyzing results.The Procurement Support team focuses on analyzing and designing the best practices for tactical and transactional procurement processes. The team is responsible for planning the implementation based on a detailed understanding of the technologies involved. The role may require for you to provide ongoing maintenance of suppliers, create catalogue content and maintain user authorization data. The team also utilizes procurement applications to provide efficient and effective transactions and maximize compliance. What are we looking for? "a) Good Procurement Process knowledge b) Expertise in overall P2P practicesc) Knowledge and hands on experience on Applications like Ariba, SAP, Oracle, S4/Hana, Cupa and MS Officed) Ensure quality of the process is upheld at all timese) Proficient in processing T&E Claim Process, Compliance Check and Dispute management f) Maintain client, customer, and supplier relationships, able understand customer queries and handle mailbox, support email triage, resolve, and loop in SME when necessary.g) Flexible to work in any shifth) Flexible to relocate the work location""Good Communication skillsGood Domain Knowledge "Any Graduation"SAP, Ariba, Oracle, Cupa & all platformsCUPA is the added advantage"  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments The decisions that you make would impact your own work You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

The team is responsible for timely and accurate billing and processing of invoices, managing purchase and non-purchase orders and two-way and three-way matching of invoices.Refers to the systematic handling and management of incoming invoices within a business or organization. It involves tasks such as verifying the accuracy of the invoice, matching it with purchase orders and delivery receipts, and initiating the payment process. Automated systems and software are often employed to streamline and expedite the invoice processing workflow, improving efficiency and reducing the likelihood of errors. What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible Ability to perform under pressure Problem-solving skills Detail orientation Ability to establish strong client relationship Accounts PayableMicrosoft Applications Process Mapping Operations Experience Client Management Accounting, Finance or any Business related course At least 2 years work experience Working Conditions Moderate to no travel depending on project involvement Cyclical work shift including work hours at night Overtime and On-Call may be required Client holidays are observed instead of Philippine or local holidays Analytical ThinkingCustomer service orientationMulti tasking / Time ManagementCommunication/Presentation skillsDecision makingTeaming / CollaborationFocus on Goals / Result orientation?Written and spoken ability to communicate in English for BPO interaction (not contact center)?Previous accounting experience/studies in particular AP?Must be a good team player?Responsibility and accuracy in the completion of received tasks?Ability to solve urgent matters and work under pressure?Flexibility, especially in the period of month/quarter/year-end closing?Experience with accounting systems?Microsoft Office skills  Roles and Responsibilities:  Invoice Processing:?Responsibility for activities assigned by the Accounts Payable Team Lead?Processes transactions of medium to difficult complexity?Processes pre-coded invoices, including those with and without a purchase order. Invoice Processor may be required to process one or all of these types of invoices (with PO, without PO)?Respond to vendor inquiries.?Ensures that all invoices assigned are properly accounted for at the end of each business day. ?Has working knowledge of both scanning and Accounts Payable application.Payments Processing:?Processing of payments transactions.?Analyse vendor statements?Manage Payment Posting Process including verifying error and perform resolution; Act as liaison to the client.?Responsible for the following tasks related to payments: Act as main contact with the Bank regarding payments queries  Process T&E related payment  Process cheque paymentTravel and Expense Processing:?Manage travel and entertainment process including:oProcessing and validating approval of T&E reports,oProcessing, reviewing and releasing for payment/rejecting electronic expense reports?Monitor and follow up on lost/missing receipts Qualification Any Graduation

column1: Procurement Governance, Audit and Compliance -Senior associate
column2: Job Summary: The role of the Senior Associate in Supply Chain Services / Enablement is to act within Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC). The successful candidate will play a key role in ensuring compliance, mitigating risks, and optimizing procurement processes. This role involves analyzing procurement data, identifying trends, recommending improvements based on best procurement practices and communicating with procurement team members and procurement business partners. T he role holder is expected to form lasting relationships with leaders and other key stakeholders to drive the development of the supply chain organization. Essential Functions of the Job: Data Analytics and Reporting for Compliance: Plan and execute procurement process compliance reviews Monitor implementation of corrective actions Prepare detailed reports and presentations for management containing key governance procurement indicators Develop and deliver training programs to educate procurement staff and stakeholders about compliance requirements Maintain a risk and issues register and suggest mitigating actions for procurement risk Utilize data-driven insights to recommend procurement process improvements Global Internal Audits support: Conduct regular procurement internal audits to ensure adherence to procurement guidelines. Support on external audit fieldwork activities Maintain audit calendar and planning Monitor remediation plans are completed Knowledge and Skills Requirements: Proven experience in procurement, supply chain management, or a related role Experience in procurement governance, procurement risk and procurement compliance activities will be a plus Excellent Excel skills  knowledge of complex formulas, lookups, pivot tables, ability to manipulate and summarize significant amounts of data into a usable format Excellent PowerPoint skills - complex information must be simplified and presented consistently to standards expected by Executive stakeholders Knowledge of ESG/ sustainability minimal requirements to apply in procurement policies and processes Very good understanding of policies and processes Very good relationship, interpersonal skills and cultural awareness Self-starter, proactive and ability to work independently Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data sets Detailed oriented and motivated to compliance Eager to collaborate with best practices and business trends Fluent in English Job Requirements: Education: Bachelors degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, or related field. Experience: At least 5 years of relevant progressive experience from a large organization, either a partnership or multi-national corporation Working experience of products & services procurement Other Requirements: Flexible working hours to accommodate Central Europe and US working hours Kindly apply for the Job via below link: https://careers.ey.com/job-invite/1479814/

column2: Coordinates and validates the customer order intake.     Manages ordering of products (HW, SW, Services).     Triggers task creations for transactions (EG purchase orders, sales orders, delivery notes, invoices, letter of credit to Business Process Owner (BPO) order management operations and monitors timely completion).     Supports coordination of the procurement execution: Captures the demand, purchase, goods receipt and verifies invoice.     Supports coordination of the distribution execution: Plans transportation, verifies freight cost and invoice, coordinates transport.     Supports coordination and validation of the customer invoice.     Supports the collect cash process, including documentary remittances (EG letter of credit) and dispute solving with customer.     Provides informal guidance and support to new team members with regard to the procedures to follow and the specific tasks required to perform the job effectively.

column1: Procure To Pay Operations Associate - Procure To Pay Processing
column2: Skill required:Procure to Pay Processing - Accounts Payable Processing  Designation:Management Level - Associate  Job Location:Jaipur  Qualifications:BCom  Years of Experience:1 to 3 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The Procure to Pay Processing team helps clients and organizations by boosting vendor compliance, cutting savings erosion, improving discount capture using preferred suppliers, and in confirming pricing and terms prior to payment. The team is responsible for accounting of goods and services, through requisitioning, purchasing and receiving. They also look after order sequence of procurement and financial process end to end. The Accounts Payable Processing team focuses on designing, implementing, managing and supporting accounts payable activities by applying the relevant processes, policies and applications. The team is responsible for timely and accurate billing and processing of invoices, managing purchase and non-purchase orders and two-way and three-way matching of invoices.  What are we looking for? SAP FI Accounts Payable  Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Problem-solving skills  Detail orientation  Ability to establish strong client relationship  The opening is in Accounts payable team where vendor Invoices will have to be checked, processed & paid Non-Voice profile for Accounts Payable core accounting " Handling email queries from vendors & internal stakeholders" " Getting the clarifications resolved from vendors & internal stakeholders by writing mails or taking calls with them" " Preparing the account or vendor reconciliations / resolving the open items coming in account reconciliations" Perform controls as per the agreed design and timelines Generate adhoc or regular reports from SAP as per the agreed process SAP experience is desired Above average communication skills Decent operational knowledge of MS Excel at least B.Com Roles and Responsibilities  In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines  Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor  You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments  The decisions that you make would impact your own work  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: Skill required:  Procurement Operations - Sourcing and Procurement Strategy Designation:  Procurement Practice Associate Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  What would you do? Go beyond processing purchase orders at lower costs to help clients reap savings and value from the billions they spend on the goods and services that run their day-to-day business operations. You will be working as a part of Procurement management team which uses a systematic approach for buying all the goods and services needed for a company to stay sustainable. They are involved in the identification of need, finding and qualifying the suppliers, requesting proposals, negotiating with suppliers, contracting, delivery and analyzing results.In this role, you would be required to have experience working in Direct or Indirect (CAPEX, MRO) categories, Tactical Buying / Spot Buys, RFx, knowledge of Req-PO processing, Procurement Help Desk / Service Desk functions, Vendor Master Data, Invoice processing, Payment processing, and other Accounts Payable functions. Functionally, you are expected to have exposure to driving transformation, process optimization, QA Frameworks, effective project management, etc. As part of the leadership role, you are expected to manage stakeholders (both internal and external), manage SLAs, drive compliance in your span as per the organizational requirements, focus on people development and work with clients to add value to the existing operations. What are we looking for? Ability to manage multiple stakeholders Ability to perform under pressure Problem-solving skills Written and verbal communication Agility for quick learning  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments The decisions that you make would impact your own work You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Graduate in Business Administration from premium B - School     5 + years of experience in the similar role preferred from the Hospitality / FMCG sector     Strong Business acumen data analytics     Attentively planning tasks and processes     A team player with strong persuasive communication skills       Job Description         Professional who combines expertise in programming, statistics, and domain knowledge to extract insights and knowledge from data     Their primary responsibility is to analyze complex data sets to uncover trends, patterns, correlations, and actionable insights that can drive informed business decisions and solve real-world problems                 Data Collection and Cleaning: Collect, aggregate, and clean raw data from various sources, ensuring data quality and integrity.             Data Exploration and Preprocessing: Explore and analyze data to gain a deep understanding of its characteristics and potential insights.             Data Visualization: Create visual representations (graphs, charts, dashboards) of data and analysis results to effectively communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders.             Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams including cluster heads, marketing, supply chain in providing MIS vs ABP deviation, ROI on campaigns etc.             Market Analysis: Conduct thorough market research and analysis to identify trends, competitive landscape, emerging opportunities, and potential risks that could impact the annual plans.             Performance Measurement: Regularly assess unit wise and cluster wise performance against defined metrics and suggest adjustments to the strategy based on data-driven insights.             Scenario Planning: Anticipate and plan for various scenarios, including industry disruptions, regulatory changes, and technological advancements. Develop contingency plans that enable the company to pivot and adapt to unforeseen circumstances.

column2: we're seeking a future team member for the role of Senior Associate to join our Enterprise Sourcing team             In this role, you'll make an impact in the following ways:           As part of the Enterprise Sourcing Office ( ESO ) Relationship Management team, this role is primarily focused on supporting Vendor Relationship Manager category leads to improve overall vendor relationships with BNY Mellon s external third parties through consistent and standardized governance activities     As part of this role, you will be involved with various activities, including but not limited to, supporting Vendor Relationship Category leads in creating periodic business review, developing and maintaining performance reviews, developing detailed vendor profiles, and other various external third-party lifecycle activities     Support Vendor Relationship managers to Develop and maintain relationships with the BNY Mellon s third parties.      Support Vendor Relationship managers with monitoring the relationships with the BNY Mellon s third parties and determine ways to optimize the relationships, create a more satisfying experience, and help drive savings.      Support Vendor Relationship managers to Conduct regular reviews with the BNY Mellon s third parties to assess performance and drive reporting to meet on-going monitoring requirements.      Support Vendor Relationship Managers to create and maintain detailed vendor profiles.            To be successful in this role, we're seeking the following:            Bachelors degree in business administration, supply chain management, or a related field.      Strong communication skills to interact with vendors and internal stakeholders.      Basic understanding of procurement processes and vendor selection criteria.      Proficiency in using vendor management software or tools, is a plus.      Attention to detail and ability to track vendor performance and compliance.      Analytical skills to assess vendor performance metrics.      Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure vendor objectives are met.      Familiarity with legal and regulatory requirements related to vendor contracts.      Prior experience in vendor management or procurement, even in internships or entry-level positions, is a plus.

column2: About Company       Founded in 2011, ReNew, is one of the largest renewable energy companies globally, with a leadership position in India. Listed on Nasdaq under the ticker RNW, ReNew develops, builds, owns, and operates utility-scale wind energy projects, utility-scale solar energy projects, utility-scale firm power projects, and distributed solar energy projects. In addition to being a major independent power producer in India, ReNew is evolving to become an end-to-end decarbonization partner providing solutions in a just and inclusive manner in the areas of clean energy, green hydrogen, value-added energy offerings through digitalisation, storage, and carbon markets that increasingly are integral to addressing climate change. With a total capacity of more than 13.4 GW (including projects in pipeline), ReNew?? solar and wind energy projects are spread across 150+ sites, with a presence spanning 18 states in India, contributing to 1.9 % of India?? power capacity. Consequently, this has helped to avoid 0.5% of India?? total carbon emissions and 1.1% India?? total power sector emissions. In the over 10 years of its operation, ReNew has generated almost 1.3 lakh jobs, directly and indirectly. ReNew has achieved market leadership in the Indian renewable energy industry against the backdrop of the Government of India?? policies to promote growth of this sector. ReNew?? current group of stockholders contains several marquee investors including CPP Investments, Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, Goldman Sachs, GEF SACEF and JERA. Its mission is to play a pivotal role in meeting India?? growing energy needs in an efficient, sustainable, and socially responsible manner. ReNew stands committed to providing clean, safe, affordable, and sustainable energy for all and has been at the forefront of leading climate action in India.            Job Description         Experience in handling Spare, Utility and Consumables of Solar Plant   Experience in Import and Vendor Development.   Prepare sourcing proposals, bid comparatives and benchmark with Last Purchase costs/ Internal Estimates.   Negotiate and Draft Purchase orders.   Ensure procurement operations follow regulations.   Join in strategic sourcing activities, bid evaluation, and vendor selection processes.   Manage delivery schedules and products.   Prepare bids based on assessment criteria for vendor selection.   Review and shortlist bid submissions.   Manage all routine interactions with the vendors for Pre and Post Order award.

Carry out the following activities , same being indicative and not exhaustive:            Raising indents and seeking quotations with clear specifications from vendors for any purchase requirements of the organization      Review and analyse quotations received, preparation of Comparative Bid Analysis Sheet; carry out negotiations with vendors for best pricing and quality      Take part in Procurement Committee Meeting as may be required      Maintenance of Procurement Committee Meetings minutes; documentation of purchase orders (complete and ongoing purchases)      Maintain and build existing Vendor Database      Ensure that products / supplies are of high quality and delivered on time      Create and maintain good relationships with vendors/suppliers      Work with team members and procurement manager to complete duties as needed      Any other related tasks as may be assigned as per requirement          Knowledge/ Skills            Strong knowledge and understanding of procurement processes, policy and systems and related legal / financial requirements        Minimum 2 years experience as a procurement officer or related position      Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel)      Ability to analyse data and make professional decisions in a fast-paced environment      Ability to negotiate, establish, and administer contracts      Good verbal and written communication skills      Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently      Accurate and precise attention to detail      Ability to work well with management and staff at all levels      Goal-oriented, organized team player          Qualification / Work Experience:        Bachelor s Degree in Humanities or business administration, accounting, or related field preferred with minimum 2 years experience as procurement officer or in similar role.

column2: Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD) is at a critically important juncture in the company s lifecycle. CSOD is the world s largest and most successful stand-alone unified Talent Management company and one of the world s largest SaaS companies.      The company is entering a phase of achieving scale and global expansion through continued relentless execution.          In this role you will...      Procurement Analyst System/Supplier Administration      Performs Procurement System Administration: Provisions new user access and assigns roles, creates and maintains approval workflows, creates and maintains custom workflows, creates and maintains external workflows related to Service Delivery Partner system utilization      Administers new supplier onboarding process in Procurement and ERP systems of record      Creates and maintains global supplier wire payment templates in respective banking portals      Supports Procurement system quality control of all purchase requisitions and supplier invoices that are not backed by purchase orders. Includes review of category, accounting, prepaid designation, and amortization schedules      Performs monthly and quarterly internal process, IT, and SOX control reporting related to Procurement system user access roles, approval workflows, and system configuration      Coordinates relationship management for third party suppliers providing diversity reporting and denied party screening.      Monitors and actions P2P Support mailbox, primary platform for Procurement system end users to request help and support with system issues.        You ve got what it takes if you have      Minimal a bachelor s degree related to accounting/finance or related experience    Intern for 1 Year    Proficient in MS office particularly Excel, Outlook & Word      Cornerstone takes special care to ensure the security and privacy of the data of its users.

column2: Skill required:  Procurement Operations - Procurement Support Designation:  Procurement Practice Associate Qualifications: Master of Business Administration/Master of Engineering  Years of Experience: 1 to 3 years  Language - Ability: English - Advanced  What would you do? Go beyond processing purchase orders at lower costs to help clients reap savings and value from the billions they spend on the goods and services that run their day-to-day business operations. You will be working as a part of Procurement management team which uses a systematic approach for buying all the goods and services needed for a company to stay sustainable. They are involved in the identification of need, finding and qualifying the suppliers, requesting proposals, negotiating with suppliers, contracting, delivery and analyzing results.The Procurement Support team focuses on analyzing and designing the best practices for tactical and transactional procurement processes. The team is responsible for planning the implementation based on a detailed understanding of the technologies involved. The role may require for you to provide ongoing maintenance of suppliers, create catalogue content and maintain user authorization data. The team also utilizes procurement applications to provide efficient and effective transactions and maximize compliance. What are we looking for? Procure to Pay (P2P) Process Design Procurement Operations Procurement Support Procurement Management SAP S/4HANA for Central Procurement Agility for quick learning Ability to manage multiple stakeholders Ability to meet deadlines  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments The decisions that you make would impact your own work You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Master of Business Administration,Master of Engineering

column2: Skill required:  Procure to Pay - Accounts Payable Processing Designation:  Procure to Pay Operations New Associate Qualifications: BCom/MCom/Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience: 0 to 1 years  What would you do? "You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.boosting vendor compliance, cutting savings erosion, improving discount capture using preferred suppliers, and in confirming pricing and terms prior to payment. Responsible for accounting of goods and services, through requisitioning, purchasing and receiving. Also look after order sequence of procurement and financial process end to end. The Accounts Payable Processing team focuses on designing, implementing, managing and supporting accounts payable activities by applying the relevant processes, policies and applications. The team is responsible for timely and accurate billing and processing of invoices, managing purchase and non-purchase orders and two-way and three-way matching of invoices.The Accounts Payable Processing team focuses on designing, implementing, managing and supporting accounts payable activities by applying the relevant processes, policies and applications. The team is responsible for timely and accurate billing and processing of invoices, managing purchase and non-purchase orders and two-way and three-way matching of invoices." What are we looking for? "Good Accounting KnowledgeProficient in Excel"  Roles and Responsibilities:  " In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your primary interaction is within your own team and your direct supervisor In this role you will be given detailed instructions on all tasks The decisions that you make impact your own work and are closely supervised You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team with a predetermined, narrow scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts" Qualification BCom,MCom,Master of Business Administration

column2: Are you a detail-oriented professional with a strong customer orientationAre you passionate about supporting business leaders with varied procurement needsIf so, we have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Senior Procurement Administrator. The Senior Procurement Administrator is responsible for supporting and coordinating the purchasing actives in procuring materials and services for iCIMS.      You must ensure high levels of accuracy and high-quality customer experience for internal employees and external vendors. In this role you will be a point of contact for a variety of procurement initiatives that span across the organization. If you are eager to leverage your procurement experience to drive efficiencies and process improvement, this may be the right fit for you!     Responsibilities             Places and processes orders, tracks order status, and provides follow-up to internal customers and external suppliers.         Participates in contract negotiations with suppliers to secure consistent supplies and competitive prices.         Proactively identifies and escalates supply constraint, pricing and supplier service issues for resolution         Consistently delivers business partner satisfaction and achievement of procurement financial objectives         Negotiates favorable contractual terms and conditions for iCIMS with suppliers.          Adheres to procurement policy to ensure compliance with internal and regulatory policies.         Ensures process documents are complete, current, communicated and stored appropriately         Builds strong relationships internally and externally with vendors, fostering collaboration and teamwork.         Tracks and reports key functional metrics to reduce expenses and improve effectiveness         Collaborates with key persons to ensure the clarity of the specifications and expectations of the company         Identifies opportunities and implements actions to achieve efficiencies.         Works with the Senior Manager, Procurement to identify and implement new processes to outsource and automate manual functions.         Provides reports on procurement metrics and results to department leadership and stakeholders.         Supports and coordinates the registration of new suppliers in company systems.         Researches new sources of services making recommendations to reduce costs and improve quality.         Maintains all required records of sourcing, negotiations and contracts.         Serves as super user for procurement systems. Provides training and support to internal customers.         Consistently ensures that business is conducted with integrity at all times and that behavior aligns with iCIMS values           Qualifications             5+ years of experience in support of a procurement department required         Work independently and as a team member, is highly organized, be goal oriented, and willing to provide high level of customer service.         Demonstrated financial acumen and understanding of corporate operations         Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.         Results oriented paying close attention to detail         Must be able to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.         Meet deadlines ensuring that projects are completed to acceptable standards.         Must have excellent telephone etiquette, as well as strong written and verbal communication skills.         Strong interpersonal skills are required for interaction with internal stakeholders and suppliers.         Proven ability to be hands on within a heavy workload environment            Preferred             Experience using an electronic signature tool, DocuSign preferred         Experience with an ERP system (NetSuite Procurement preferred)           EEO Statement           iCIMS is a place where everyone belongs. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our approach helps us to build a winning team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. So, regardless of how your diversity expresses itself, you can find a home here at iCIMS.             We are proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, genetic information, disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at careers@icims.com.         Compensation and Benefits         Competitive health and wellness benefits include medical, dental, vision, 401(k), dependent care, short term and long term disability, life and ADD insurance, bonding and parental leave, mindfulness resources, an open vacation policy, sick days, paid holidays, quiet hours each workday, and tuition reimbursement. Benefits and eligibility may vary by location, role, and tenure. Learn more here: https: /  / careers.icims.com / benefits          5+ years of experience in support of a procurement department required         Work independently and as a team member, is highly organized, be goal oriented, and willing to provide high level of customer service.         Demonstrated financial acumen and understanding of corporate operations         Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.         Results oriented paying close attention to detail         Must be able to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.         Meet deadlines ensuring that projects are completed to acceptable standards.         Must have excellent telephone etiquette, as well as strong written and verbal communication skills.         Strong interpersonal skills are required for interaction with internal stakeholders and suppliers.         Proven ability to be hands on within a heavy workload environment              Places and processes orders, tracks order status, and provides follow-up to internal customers and external suppliers.         Participates in contract negotiations with suppliers to secure consistent supplies and competitive prices.         Proactively identifies and escalates supply constraint, pricing and supplier service issues for resolution         Consistently delivers business partner satisfaction and achievement of procurement financial objectives         Negotiates favorable contractual terms and conditions for iCIMS with suppliers. Ensures process documents are complete, current, communicated and stored appropriately         Builds strong relationships internally and externally with vendors, fostering collaboration and teamwork. column2: Skill required:  Procure to Pay - Payment Processing Operations Designation:  Associate Qualifications: BCom,Master of Business Administration,MCom  Years of Experience: 1 - 3 Years  Language - Ability: English - Expert  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.boosting vendor compliance, cutting savings erosion, improving discount capture using preferred suppliers, and in confirming pricing and terms prior to payment. Responsible for accounting of goods and services, through requisitioning, purchasing and receiving. Also look after order sequence of procurement and financial process end to end. The Accounts Payable Processing team focuses on designing, implementing, managing and supporting accounts payable activities by applying the relevant processes, policies and applications. The team is responsible for timely and accurate billing and processing of invoices, managing purchase and non-purchase orders and two-way and three-way matching of invoices.The Payment Processing Operations team is responsible for making payments using checks, wire, swift, direct debits, etc. as part of the invoice processing cycle. The team also executes manual payments and automated payment runs, run potential duplicate payments reports and take appropriate action, and execute payment-related controls. The role requires a good understanding of vendor payments, Travel and Expense (T&E) payments, and taxation. What are we looking for? Procurement Operations4+ years' experience working in a finance, internal control, or audit-related functionStrong facility with Excel, Google Workspace (Google Docs, Slides, Spreadsheets, gMail) and SAP payments systemsStrong analytical and problem solving skillsExcellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize heavy workloads with attention to detail.Excellent interpersonal, communication, and stakeholder management skills  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BCom,MCom,Master of Business Administration

column1: GN - SC&O - S&P - Procurement Transformation - Analyst
column2: Sourcing and Procurement  Analyst/ Consultant  Find endless opportunities to solve  our clients' toughest challenges, as you work with  exceptional people, the latest  tech  and leading companies across industries. Practice: Supply Chain and Operations, Industry Consulting,  Global  Network  I Areas of Work: Sourcing and Procurement ,  Supply Chain Management  |  Level: Analyst/ Consultant |  Location: Gurgaon, Delhi, Mumbai,  Bangalore |  Years of Exp: 2-4  years Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture Are you an outcome-oriented problem solver? Do you enjoy working on transformation strategies for global clients? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest?  Then,  is the right place for you to explore limitless possibilities. As a part of our  practice, you will help organizations reimagine and transform their supply chains for tomorrow-with a positive impact on  the business ,  society  and the planet. Together,  let's  innovate, build competitive advantage, improve business, and societal outcomes, in an ever-changing, ever-challenging world. Help us make supply chains work better, faster, and be more resilient, with the following initiatives: Deliver sourcing and procurement engagements  in the areas of strategic cost reduction, sourcing optimization, procurement transformation, intelligent procurement using tools such as Ariba, Coupa, IVALUA, Zycus and Jaggaer, responsible and resilient procurement, mergers and acquisitions for clients, across industries and geographies. Key activities including but not limited to-  Identify, evaluate and prioritize sourcing opportunities  through in-depth spend analysis, market research, and so on.  Support execution of various stages  of strategic cost reduction, zero based budgeting and operations value transformation programs.  Support implementation of procurement solutions including requirements gathering, technical design definition,define test scenarios & scripts  to ensure that the configured solution meets clients' requirements and be comfortable working with application developers & managing multiple stakeholders  Design sourcing and procurement operating model including organisation structure, processes & technology enablers aligned to traditional & emerging business priorities such as responsible sourcing principles, net zero emission targets etc  Define and execute sourcing optimization initiatives  such as indirect sourcing and cost take-out, direct sourcing and should-cost modeling, category management, and so on.  Support in business development activities  such as responding to proposal requests, conducting roadshows/demos, staffing management, people engagement, asset development and so on.  Bring your best skills forward to excel in the role: Ability to define and implementprocurement operating models impacting procurement organization, processes & technology landscape  Ability to define and execute end-to-end sourcing & procurement processes including  category management & procurement analytics, supplier management, sourcing, contracts & order/goods receipt/invoice management  Ability to develop business case for procurement transformation initiatives such as  implementation of source-to-pay solutions (egAriba, Coupa, Ivalua, Zycus, Jaggaer and so on), operating model changes etc  Excellent data analytics and data interpretation and presentation skills Ability to solve complex business problems  and deliver client delight  Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills  Cross-cultural competence  with an ability to thrive in a dynamic environment  Qualification Read  more  about us.
column11: spend analysis, data analytics, data interpretation, presentation skills, market research, supply chain, supplier management, supply, sourcing, direct procurement, procurement, supply chain management, indirect sourcing, ariba, category management, coupa

column2: ?                 Technical Competencies:                           Must have around 5-8 years of hands-on experience in SAP MM module with atleast 2 to 3 end to end implementation projects                      Must have deep understanding of procurement best practices, very good functional and configuration experience in following areas of SAP MM                     Material Master, Business Partner, Purchase Requisitions, Purchase Orders, Outline Agreements, Release strategies, Pricing, Intercompany Billing, Special Procurement, output determination for messages, Reports.                     Inventory Management (Goods Movement, Physical Inventory count Cycle counts, ABC analysis) Valuation and split valuation and Account Determination. Logistics Invoice Verification, Credit Memos, Account Payables, Classification.                       Must have very good hands-on experience in handling SAP MM interfaces with other applications through middleware. column1: Job description: Oracle Fusion Cloud Procurement Specialist
column2: We are looking for an Oracle Cloud Procurement Specialist to join our ERP team. The candidate shall supervise business requirements by leading functional design and process design stages of Oracle Cloud procurement implementations. The person shall provide thought leadership and guidance to clients to implement modern best practices and functionality of cloud applications. Serve as a leader, collaborate, and communicate effectively among client stakeholders and project team members to mitigate risks, enable transformation, define business outcomes, and document change impacts for better user adoption and successful deployment. Job Responsibilities: Analyze business processes and assist clients in transforming their current business processes to Oracle Cloud Procurement application. Provide thought leadership around industry-leading practices for improving operational efficiencies and profitability of client business. Design, prototype, and iterate solutions in Oracle for Federal, State, and Local clients to resolve pain points and achieve customer satisfaction. Configure Oracle Procurement Cloud application based on business requirements and functional design. Lead and manage a small team of consultants as required by the project. Perform pre-sales activities, such as demonstrating solutions to potential customers and participating in proposal creation. Responsible for capturing business requirements, functional design, configuration, PaaS extensions, data conversions, integrations, and reporting. Prepare training materials and SOPs to help train the end users and validate solutions. Provide status updates to internal teams, client teams and executive leadership throughout the project. Stay updated on the latest Oracle Procurement trends to provide the best practical solutions to clients. Required Qualifications: 5+ years of Oracle Procurement Cloud implementation and/or support experience Integration experience with third party procurement applications Strong experience in all functional aspects of cloud application; requirements gathering, functional design, conversion, configuration, PaaS extensions, validation testing, integration, and deployment Oracle Procurement application implementation and support experience in these business functions: Supplier Model, Registration Process and Supplier Qualification Supplier Portal, Solicitation to Award Processing and Contract Management Requisition to Invoice Processing; OCR/IDR invoice processing understanding Funds Checking /Project Budgeting Oracle Certification in Procurement module would be an added advantage. Experience in Oracle Cloud OTBI, BI Publisher, and other Reporting tools is a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication along with strong analytical skills

column2: Skill required:  Procure to Pay - Accounts Payable Processing Designation:  Associate Qualifications: BBA,BCom,Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience: 1 - 3 Years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The Procure to Pay Processing team helps clients and organizations by boosting vendor compliance, cutting savings erosion, improving discount capture using preferred suppliers, and in confirming pricing and terms prior to payment. The team is responsible for accounting of goods and services, through requisitioning, purchasing and receiving. They also look after order sequence of procurement and financial process end to end. The Accounts Payable Processing team focuses on designing, implementing, managing and supporting accounts payable activities by applying the relevant processes, policies and applications. The team is responsible for timely and accurate billing and processing of invoices, managing purchase and non-purchase orders and two-way and three-way matching of invoices. What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Problem-solving skills  Ability to establish strong client relationship  Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines  Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor  You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments  The decisions that you make would impact your own work  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BBA,BCom,Master of Business Administration
column11: accounts payable, pay, invoice processing, procure to pay, procurement, strategic sourcing, procurement operations, purchase, purchase order, vendor payments, p2p, purchase management, vendor development, material management, supply chain management

column2: As Associate Senior Specialist at our Shared Service Center in Hyderabad, India, you will be responsible for managing Buyer support activities related to Global Procurement and needs to be perform as per the organization s policies and guidelines.     The role includes providing Procurement support activities to the buyers & businesses across the regions.     The role reports to Service Center Team Leader.         How you will contribute         First point of contact for the Buyers, Sites & Suppliers.         Provide support in managing end to end documentation and administration activities to all stakeholders.         Execute and provide transactional support to strategic buying team (system & process support).         Create, amend and maintain purchasing documents in IFF tools & systems.         Creation and management of Catalog.         Analyze business requirements and identifies reliable suppliers to meet business requirements.         Participate & support in the development of sourcing strategies.         Look for saving opportunities and productivity gains, which may include working with Improvement Leaders and Service Center personnel.         Looks for alternative sources, through individual research, past data and working with other Buyers, Sr Buyers, and Executive Buyers.         Assist Vendor Master team in onboarding of new vendors or for changes in data.         Monitor and execute all transactions according to our internal controls and policies.         Effectively communicate and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to assure timely supply of goods and services to clients.         Administration and reporting as necessary (from internal systems and external sources).         Liaise with regional and global buying teams, providing information & analytical support in alignment with their goals on portfolio management and savings.         Drive continuous improvement / process optimization on specific areas of the RTP process.          Ensure SOX compliance         Perform a wide range of work requests that are assigned / requested by the Buy Team (Buyers group) using broader knowledge of Sourcing, Procurement & Supply Chain via SAP Applications which includes:         Creation, Amendment, Renewal & Management of Contracts/Agreements for the various commodities which involves working with Global Buyers, Suppliers to get need attributes etc         Creation and amendment of Purchase Orders in line with company s policies & guidelines.         Manage Buyer Work Requests (BWR).         Manage Spot Purchases for certain commodities under the approved threshold Sourcing the Supplier as per Company strategy, Receiving Quotations from Suppliers, negotiating with Suppliers on Price & Payment Terms (as per process).         Evaluate and select suppliers in terms of quality, service, cost and capability.         Support buyers in supplier analysis and research data.         Expedite delivery of material to ensure suppliers deliver goods / services on time.          Handle Invoice Disputes and resolving the same to make sure Suppliers get paid on time / excess & incorrect payments are not made.         Participate in Projects, SME Networks, Process updates, Best Practice Implementation.         What you will need to be successful         Masters or Bachelors degree in Commerce / Finance or any other relevant discipline.         At least 4-5 years of experience in Global Procurement supporting Global operations and clients.         Sourcing experience and commodity knowledge is preferred.         Sound knowledge of SAP, SRM tools or other related ERP systems (Knowledge of Zycus preferred).         Good Interpersonal & Analytical Skills.         Good working knowledge in MS Office applications.         Excellent verbal and written communication skills         Key connect between clients, suppliers and buyers, candidates must exhibit a high degree of professionalism and tact.         Negotiation knowledge         Contract Management knowledge         Procurement / Supply Chain process & system knowledge.         Flexible to work in shift timings to support multiple regions.         Self-driven, results oriented with positive attitude towards changes and new challenges

column2: Buckman is seeking associates to work in our Procurement Shared Services team. Education                      Bachelors degree, supply chain management, or a related field.                              ?         Work Experience                        2 - 4 years work experience in purchasing, procurement or in supply chain with the similar industry along with experience in SAP. Shared Service experience with a global organization would be an added advantage.                                    ?         Key Outcomes / Responsibilities              Like SAP Purchase info records (PIR) Updates, manage Supplier MDM and Material MDM updates, Supplier Contact details, Price updates, Inbound freight - manage surcharges vs actuals and update quarterly.              Reporting Monthly forecast to top suppliers, Eco Vadis reporting, and Purchase info records (PIR) report (spend cube)              Handling of Import/Export HTS codes from suppliers, Long-term declarations - Country of Origin              ISO Supplier questionnaires follow-up              Vendor Setup on New Material set ups and ZFLOW              Indirect Spend / catalogue Management and perform catalogue management within SAP - selection and ordering of goods and services while ensuring compliance with negotiated contracts and pricing.              Miscellaneous Sample ordering, Regulatory documents requests follow-up, CCAR follow-up closure Returns, Invoice discrepancy resolution, SharePoint Team site administration              Ensure compliance with procurement policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.          Supporting any procurement related activities as required by the organisation.                    Required Skills and Job Competencies            Flexible with the timing - Ideally able to mirror NA or EU time-zones              Good written and verbal communication skills              Specific skill sets related to data management and analytics              Strong customer focus and interpersonal skills              Proven experience in procurement, purchasing, or supply chain management.          Knowledge of relevant regulations and best practices in procurement.

column2: The Senior Procurement Admin has developed specialized Procurement-specific skills through job-related training and considerable on-the-job experience      They can provide support to their team with a limited degree of supervision      The Senior Procurement Admin can be an informal resource for colleagues with less experience      The Senior Procurement Admin is skilled in various processes, procedures, and systems            Essential Qualifications and Education:            Bachelor s Degree in a related discipline      At least 5 years of professional experience with a background in Procure to Pay and Shared Service Delivery model      Be highly organized with high attention to detail      Be able to maintain control, while remaining flexible      Knowledgeable in IT Equipment and consumables ordering via the procurement channel      Understand the Unifi process      Able to navigate the procedures to find answers            Key Tasks and Responsibilities:            Support the Supply Chain Admin Supervisor      Acts as a source of help and support to less experienced administrators      Identify problem areas and escalate as appropriate      Manage the vendor pre-qualification process      Manage the vendor performance measurement      Manage and resolve invoice disputes      Compile and issue sub-contract documentation      Work with the Company Supplier Registration, Qualifications, and procurement systems      Understand Supplier Registration Qualification principles and systems      Maintain records of stock movements and produce monthly stock reports      Inventory control of stock and availability management of spares to meet the demand levels

column2: Vendor Identification and Evaluation:         Conduct market research to identify potential vendors and suppliers in the logistics industry.     Evaluate vendors based on predefined criteria such as capabilities, capacity, quality standards, financial stability, and track record.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their requirements and align vendor selection accordingly.         Vendor Negotiation and Contracting:         Negotiate favorable terms, pricing, and contracts with vendors, ensuring cost efficiency and value for the company.     Establish and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with vendors, fostering collaboration and continuous improvement.     Monitor and enforce vendor compliance with contractual obligations, service level agreements, and quality standards.         Vendor Performance Management:         Define and implement vendor performance metrics and KPIs to assess vendor performance regularly.     Conduct periodic vendor performance reviews, addressing any issues or concerns, and identifying areas for improvement.     Collaborate with vendors to drive continuous improvement initiatives and optimize service levels.         Vendor Risk Management:         Identify and mitigate potential risks associated with vendor relationships, such as financial instability, quality issues, or disruptions in the supply chain.     Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies, including contingency plans and alternative sourcing options.         Market Analysis and Benchmarking:         Stay updated with industry trends, market dynamics, and emerging technologies related to logistics and vendor management.     Conduct benchmarking exercises to compare vendor performance, pricing, and service quality against industry standards.         Collaboration and Cross-functional Support:         Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including operations, procurement, and finance teams, to understand their requirements and align vendor selection accordingly.     Provide support and guidance to cross-functional teams regarding vendor-related matters, fostering effective communication and collaboration.         Who You Are         Must be a Hindi speaking candidate. (Native Speaker)     Bachelors degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or a related field. Relevant certifications are a plus.     Minimum 2 years proven experience in vendor management, sourcing, or procurement within the logistics / supply chain / Procurement / Purchase department or functions.     Strong knowledge of logistics operations, vendor evaluation methodologies, and negotiation strategies.     Excellent analytical skills and ability to interpret data to drive decision-making.     Strong negotiation and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with vendors and internal stakeholders.     Familiarity with logistics platforms, software, and tools is preferred.     Proactive and results-oriented mindset, with the ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.     Experience in RFQs, RFIs and E-Procurement Platforms will be an added advantage.
column11: Supply chain, Market analysis, Supply chain management, Performance management, Strategic sourcing, Market research, Risk management, Continuous improvement, Service quality, Logistics

column2: This position is primarily responsible for providing and assisting support for all India procurement of Indirect purchase. As such, the incumbent indirect sourcing teams that are responsible for executing, negotiating, implementing and maintaining competitively advantageous supply arrangements for the regional indirect purchasing.          IV. DIMENSIONS:                Average Annual Spend Managed          USD 0.5~ 1 MM            Categories Supported Regionally            Admin, IT Tools, AMC/Service Contracts renewal, facility management, office set up procurement, PPE s                  V. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES          Within the sourcing category of their responsibility:            Identifications of bidders/ sub-contractors for the goods/ services under indirect purchasing and their registration in SAP.          Issuance of RFQ.          Seek technical approval from respective discipline on techno-commercial offers, making comparative statements and recommendations to Senior Management for review and approval;          Creation of SAP PO and release. Clear understanding of PO and Service order terms w r t supply of goods and services.          Execute source process by developing, negotiating, implementing, and sustaining supply/ service contracts consistent with business/project requirements.          Execute the sourcing work process in accordance with the Air Products approved work processes, including SAP purchase order processing and contract management.          Invoice approvals in SAP, timely payment of Vendors and their payment reconciliation.          Closely monitors the market for indirect spend and update price developments to maximize leverage and minimize risk          Provide support and information in cost discovery, supplier discovery and development work to meet project and business needs to strengthen competitive advantage for the corporation.          Work closely with supported businesses and functional organizations to ensure stability and cost effectiveness of supply.          Bring innovative supplier solutions to maximize value proposition across the supply chain for indirect purchase.          Manage supplier performance and maintain interface within supplier s organization.          Generate a monthly report about current spend on the indirect and using report for each prior fiscal year to forecast the yearly outlook based on current contractual obligations.                  V. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS                  Qualifications - Any Graduate            5 to 7 years of indirect purchase experience.          Preferable with working experience in Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC), Industrial Gases or Petrochemicals / Chemicals or Oil Gas Industries.          Worked with a multinational company in a matrix set up will be an advantage.          Detailed knowledge of commercial purchasing procedures and practices, including aspects of negotiation, contract law and claims management.
